intro: Labisia pumila var. neriifolia, commonly known as the black-leafed labisia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy texture, while the stems are often covered in a fine, woolly layer. This plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental species due to its attractive appearance. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
